body.name: KTC 27 inch Curved Gaming Monitor, 165Hz 1ms MPRT, 2K 1440P 144Hz Monitor, 1500R HVA Display, FreeSync Premium, HDR, 120%sRGB, DisplayPort/HDMI/USB, Vesa Support 3.9x3.9'', Computer Monitor for Gamers
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Thursday, February 15. Order within 3 hrs 11 mins
features: [Immersive 1500R HVA & High Resolution] With the 1500R curved HVA panel and Wide Quad High Definition 2560 x 1440p, this PC gaming monitor plunges you deep into the gaming world, giving you an edge to detect threats and seize opportunities faster than your rivals.

[Pro-Level Gaming Performance with 165Hz 1ms Adaptive Sync] Unleash your inner pro-gamer with a blazing 165Hz monitor refresh rate. The lightning-quick 1ms MPRT response time eliminates motion blur, ensuring a silky-smooth gaming experience. Plus, this 2K gaming monitor supports Adaptive Sync, compatible with both FreeSync Premium and G-SYNC.

[Expansive 120% sRGB Color Gamut & HDR10] Unleash a world of vibrant colors and high dynamic range with an exceptional 120% sRGB color gamut & HDR10. Unlike ordinary monitors, this 27 inch monitor enhances hues and features, making your visuals truly pop.

[Adundant Connectivity & Ergonomic design] Pc monitor gaming equips HDMI, DP, USB, earphone jack and DC ports interfaces for enhanced gaming connectivity. Ergonomic design with tilt adjustment -5°-15°and VESA(3.9*3.9’’) mounting options, perfect for gamers, office workers, and designers alike.

[GamePlus] Crosshairs ensures pinpoint FPS accuracy. Black eQualizer reveals hidden details in the dark. Eliminate FPS drops with KTC's GAMEPLUS Timer for seamless, immersive gaming. What a excellent 27” curved gaming monitor!

Previous page Expansive 120% sRGB Color Gamut & HDR10 4000 : 1 Contrast Ratio making your visuals truly pop. Eye Saver Mode Less blue light,no flicker. Next page 1 Brilliant Colors 2 4000 : 1 Contrast Ratio 3 Low Blue-light Mode

Enjoy multiple connectivity options with HDMI2.0(@144Hz), DP1.2*2(@165Hz), USB 2.0, Earphone Jack and DC. Perfect for laptops, PS5, XBOX, Switch, and more. Ergonomic design allows front and back tilt (-5°-15°), plus VESA support (3.9*3.9'') for easy installation.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great monitor for gaming
reviews.reviewText: It is been a while since I have used a standard 16 x 9 monitor. I am coming from an Alienware 38 inch ultra wide. Initial thoughts on this monitor are that build construction is actually better than the alienware there’s no cheap plastic. it has a very sturdy case, and I am very confident in hanging this on the wall. I have always used TV wall mounts, although this is on the heavier side, the Walmart I have is rated up to 100 pounds.Initial use shows that there are many formats included on the monitor including a 21 x 9 so if I ever wanted to go back to ultra wide for specific game I can by changing the screen accepted format through the ktc osd menu.For what I am using this monitor for I cannot tell the difference with the matte coating. Using it in a dark room with no true light. There are LEDs around the room, but no pure whites, so the room is fairly dark.I will update my review in a few days after I have time to use the monitor for more extensive purposes. I did briefly test, Starfield, callisto protocol and cyberpunk.The reason I wanted to test these was because of the horrendous blooming in HDR on my IPS monitor for the initial blooming test. There is a reason oled is better.Since I have multiple screens, this will primarily be for gaming, and I am not too concerned with burn in or derogation.The only thing that I have looked into his firmware updates and the G48P5S is not listed on their website. I have not reached out to KTC to find out if there is a firmware update or if the firmware update is the same as the G42P5.The G48P5S does have transfer rates on the HDMI according to the spec sheet so therefore I am unwilling to test the smaller monitors firmware on this unitI will update this review once I spend more time with the monitor1/14/24 reached out to ktc as the 48 inch monitor does not show up on their support page, and wanted to know about any firmware updates as the g42p5 has firmware updates. Where as the g48p5s is the 2023 model with hdmi 2.1 at 48 GbpsUpdate 1/22/24Love gaming on this monitor, one downside is if the monitor goes to sleep it is not waking properly. I have to use the remote to turn off and then back on. The large red blinking led on the bottom is slightly annoying when the monitor is off

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I like very much this monitor. The colors are vivid and handle very well fast pace movies. I recommend this. Monitor to anyone.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great picture and great value.
reviews.reviewText: This is really a great monitor for the price. I took away one star because it uses a wall-wart power supply with a very short cord.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I really like EVERYTHING about this monitor. Everything that the listing describes is true. I only wish it had a 3yr. warranty rather than a 1yr. warranty. However, I can always purchase an extended one.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars AMAZING !! No Doubt best for price !!!
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. Well I don’t usually leave many review because do people actually read or are people writing reviews actually honest? Well after spending Hr’s watching YouTube reviews , reading looking at display type , what is the right colors and all the stuff … well let me say this is by all means BEST MONITOR you will buy. It’s worth every single cent and without a shadow of the doubt best BANG for your buck!!!! No brained buy !! Awesome overall everything!!! Just look at the amazing picture it displays!!! Sharp vibran colors !!! Amazing for ESCAPE FROM TARKOV, CALL OF DUTY, all sorts of games !! Worth it !!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Brilliant display ruined be horrible design choices
reviews.reviewText: The actual display itself looks amazing. However, as a monitor this is unusable. If all you do is gaming, it might be good enough, but why pay for a premium monitor that has serious issues.1) There is an over scan problem, even using DisplayPort. If you use DSC, the left and the bottom of the screen are clipped. If you turn DSC off, the top and right edges are clipped. This strikes me as the designers made a TV, not a monitor. You WILL have display scaling. If I can't see every pixel as it's supposed to be, it's not really a monitor, it's a TV.2) They are so paranoid about burn in, that unless a significant portion of the screen changes, it starts to dim. Even writing this review, I had to stop several times and change windows to get the screen to come back from being so dim it was hard to see. Simply changing what's displayed gets the brightness back. Again, if you're just gaming, that might be okay. But even simple desktop tasks like reading/writing email or heaven forbid trying to write code causes the screen to dim to unusable levels.3) It doesn't come with a stand or mount of any kind. Look carefully at the specs and it doesn't say it comes with one. The main picture has the stand with a dotted line. Their own stand is $120 after coupon, but any VESA 100x100 or 300x300 will work. Every TV or monitor I've seen comes with at least a simple, cheap stand. Not a show stopper, but very frustrating since I don't believe they made it clear enough.4) It's heavy. The LG 48" OLED is 33 lbs. This one is 56! It's the same physical display, it's just the electronic and case that's different. Again, not a huge deal, but still worth noting.I could certainly live with issues 3) and 4). Items 1) and 2) are both huge issues for me that make this monitor unusable.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars WOW! For this price it is a steal!
reviews.reviewText: I was skeptical about getting a brand i didn't recognize but my son has started getting into gaming an really wanted a curved monitor, I have been PC gaming for years but never bought into the curved monitor idea. it came in and i was really impressed with the packaging and once we got it set up the picture quality was great and it was very responsive. My only issue is that I bought it for my son... now I guess I'll need to get one or three for myself.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Solid Budget Monitor
reviews.reviewText: I do not think you can find a better budget monitor on the market at the time of my purchase. I only have one complaint, being that it uses a super cheap cable that is also annoyingly short. Other than the terrible stock cable, this screen cannot be beat. I would like to point out a few things such as the all metal (I believe it to be aluminum) stand and base, the thin bezels, refresh rate, and low latency. I am by no means a professional gamer, but I cannot personally discern any input lag. From what I have read in reviews everyone seems to be loving this monitor and that was why I bought mine. I am very happy with my purchase.
